result.execSummary:
The defendant Franklin John Bignell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Franklin John Bignell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Franklin John Bignell was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
AMENDED 02-06-2015:  Attorney fees approved 11/04/14 to 12/09/14 of $231.00 + $301.00 from 12/09/14 to 02/03/15 for a total of $532.00.  Apply $400.00 on deposit.

No possession or consumption of alcohol;
No entrance into bars or taverns without the advanced written permission of Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 10 days jail consecutive to any other periods of incarceration.  May be served in Eau Claire County if at no cost to Pepin County and is traditional jail, no electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: Any other periods of incarceration.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 15R 000350 - Payment for balance of County Appointed Attorney Fees owing.
Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $301.00 are allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements.
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees
Counts 1 & 3 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

Defendant Franklin John Bignell in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Defendant Franklin John Bignell in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of resolution.  State moves to dismiss Counts 1 & 3, defendant will plead to Count 2. Judge advises defendant of charge in Count 2/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 2, Dismiss Counts 1&3.  Sentence w/held, probation 1 year with conditions.  Advised of appeal rights.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

No possession or consumption of alcohol;
No entry into bars or taverns.
Cash bond amended to signature bond.

Defendant Franklin John Bignell in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Defendant Franklin John Bignell in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan continues to waive time limits for P.H., requests cash bond be amended to signature bond.  No objection by State.  Court amends cash bond to signature bond, conditions remain in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty. 11/04/14 - 12/09/14.  Ordered that $231.00 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements to date.
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Atty Fees from 11/07/14 - 12/09/14
Adjourned initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Franklin John Bignell in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Defendant Franklin John Bignell in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan informs the court defendant is being revoked on OWI 6th, schedule this case at same time.  Defendant requests Atty Morgan be appt'd on that case as well.  Order appointed Atty Morgan when Revocation Order & Warrant rec'd & schedule both matters at same time.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 1, 2014 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Franklin John Bignell in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Defendant Franklin John Bignell in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.

Ordered that Attorney Allan Morgan is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 12-01-2014, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

No possession or consumption of alcohol; 
No entry into bars or taverns.

Defendant Franklin John Bignell in court, in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $1000 cash bond based on criminal history, previous battery charge, alcohol involved.  Defendant currently on PO hold.  Court sets $1000 cash bond which can be reviewed if hold released.  Defendant does not qualify for SPD at this time.  Court appoints Atty Allan Morgan as defense counsel with repayment agreement.  Advised of right to prelim. hrg. w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  Matter adjourned to next Monday.  Conditions of release:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 11:45 am.
